Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Cryptdin-4 (Crp4, Crp-4; cryp04, natural AMPs; defensins; UCSS1a; mouse, rodents, mammals, animals; 3S=S; derivative: linear crp4)
Sequence Information.Crucial residues: A few residues at the N-terminus are critical for antibacterial activities.

Literature Information.Literature: Activity: Active against E. coli and S. aureus or MRSA.Structure: It contains three disulfide bonds.You can rotate, zoom, and view the 3D structureherein the PDB.SAR: replacing 6 cys with Ala led to linear crp4. It shows similar antibacterial activity to crp4. However, the linear form appeared to be more effective than the WT to complete inhibit the bacteria (Wang et al., 2023). Updated 2/2014; 7/2021; seq/SAR 2/2023
Literature Information.Author: Ouellette,A.J., Hsieh,M.M., Nosek,M.T., Cano-Gauci,D.F., Huttner,K.M., Buick,R.N., Selsted,M.E.1994
Literature Information.Title: Mouse Paneth cell defensins: primary structures and antibacterial activities of numerous cryptdin isoforms.
